info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 3:59PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN SANTA FE, BERNALILLO AND NORTHWESTERN TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 359 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Edgewood, or 7 miles west of Moriarty, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Edgewood, Moriarty, Escabosa, Cedar Grove, Chilili, Ponderosa Pines and Miera. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 184 and 207. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for central New Mexico.
